author: ajsutton
content:
I’ve heard the term but not sure if you’re referencing something specific. I say people won’t set up a second validator not because they have something to lose if they do but because it costs them time and money to do so they need something to gain. It just isn’t worth the effort. 

But they do actually have something to lose. It would be quite easy to get themselves slashed by running the same fork on both nodes either now or in the future. And a fork is bad for the minority chain which reduces the value of their stake. Maybe it’s made up for in the value of the other fork but there’s no guarantee. 

Anyway I think we’re well off topic here - the point is that there is active effort required to sustain a fork of the beacon chain similar to how the difficulty bomb requires for forks in PoW.
